sentences.en: But the very imminence of the emergency paralyzed his invention . Good!
sentences.cn: 常言说得好,急中生智,可汤姆这回却束手无策,对,就这么办.

sentences.en: He had doubt about the imminence of war.
sentences.cn: 他不相信战争已迫在眉睫.

sentences.en: Perhaps the imminence of her own mortality had helped her find this precious balance and perspective.
sentences.cn: 也许是她所面临过的失败帮助她找到这样精准的平衡以及观点.

sentences.en: The imminence of negotiations thus probably spurred rather than delayed his dicision.
sentences.cn: 因此,谈判日益逼近这一事实很有可能不是推迟而是促使他下了决心.

sentences.en: The imminence of war was on everyone's mind.
sentences.cn: 每个人都感受到了战争的迫近。

sentences.en: The imminence requirement is extremely important in international affairs.
sentences.cn: 这种紧迫性的要求在国际事务中是极其重要的.

sentences.en: These nouns all denote the agitation and anxiety caused by the presence or imminence of danger.
sentences.cn: 这些名词都含有因危险的出现或迫近而引起的不安和焦虑之意.

words.tran_cn: 迫切；急迫，危急；迫近的危险或祸患

trans.tran_cn: 急迫，危急，迫近的危险（或祸患）
